text: Those who wanted to sleep, not out of tiredness but out of nostalgia for dreams, resorted to all sorts of exhausting methods. They would meet to talk without pause, repeat the same jokes for hours and hours, complicate the story of the hound cap to the limits of exasperation, which was an infinite game where the narrator asked if they wanted me to tell them the story of the hound cap, and when they answered yes, the narrator said that he had not asked them to say yes, but that if they wanted me to tell them the story of the hound cap, and when they answered no, the narrator said that he had not asked them to say no, but that if they wanted me to tell them the story of the hound cap, and when they were silent, the narrator said that he had not asked them to stay silent, but that if they wanted the story of the hound cap to be told, and that there was no one to go around, the narrator said that they would not be silent, and that if they wanted to keep silent, they would not be silent, and that if they wanted to go around the circle, they would not be silent, and that they would not be silent. FIN
title: El cuento del gallo capón
author: Gabriel García Márquez
